intro: Alchemilla vulgaris proles sylvestris, commonly known as the woodland lady’s mantle, is a perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of heart-shaped, silver-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in summer, which are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its foliage is covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive, almost fuzzy appearance.
